definition: facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I have been exposed to the presentiment of catastrophe for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期來我一直有大禍臨頭的感覺。

sentences.english: For me, the july twentieth affair was in every way a calamity .
sentences.chinese: 就我來說，七月二十日事件完全是大禍臨頭。

sentences.english: During the past the week, I almost always feeling having disaster strikes.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期來我一直有大禍臨頭的感覺。

sentences.english: A rise in interest rates would be disastrous for millions.
sentences.chinese: 利率的增長對數百萬人來說是大禍臨頭。

sentences.english: Damn boys don't think about the wrath that's about to set down on them.
sentences.chinese: 混小子，也不想想，他們就快要大禍臨頭了。

sentences.english: Oh, calamity , is there no way out?
sentences.chinese: 噢大禍臨頭了這下可有生路？

sentences.english: "This is a catastrophe for Iran's cinema, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “這對伊朗的電影業來說是大禍臨頭，”他說。

sentences.english: For weeks, I have had a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期來我一直有大禍臨頭的感覺。

sentences.english: "This is a catastrophe for Iran's cinema," he said.
sentences.chinese: “這對伊朗的電影業來說是大禍臨頭，”他說。
